     tabstops = {},

+    navigation_mappings = navigation_mappings,

comment_data.body:
could leave the door open for other kinds of mappings in the future?

also given `vim.keymap` maybe we should stick to "keymap" 

```suggestion
--- @alias vim.snippet.Keymap { jump_forward: string, jump_backward: string }
```
Sure, but we should keep the plural.

comment_regular_data.body: A note: allowing configurable mappings on `vim.lsp.completion` level and not on `vim.snippet` level places plugins/users who directly use `vim.snippet` at a disadvantage. That means that any plugin wanting to use `vim.snippet` directly (which is an eventual `vim.snippet` design and is already a reality for several popular plugins) will have no good way of preventing `<Tab>` / `<S-Tab>` being forced after snippet expansion.

>  will have no good way of preventing <Tab> / <S-Tab> being forced after snippet expansion.

Wat. The whole point of this is to _set_ these mappings ONLY in a specific context (and opt-in). Plugins can do whatever they want, and instruct users _not_ to opt-in if they handle this themselves.


And this in no way precludes adding configuration on the vim.snippet level -- this is merely meant as a stop-gap for 0.11 until we figure out WHAT and HOW should be configured (which will influence the design). We heard your mini.snippet desires, but frankly that's not enough to base a core design on.

> A note: allowing configurable mappings on `vim.lsp.completion` level and not on `vim.snippet` level places plugins/users who directly use `vim.snippet` at a disadvantage. That means that any plugin wanting to use `vim.snippet` directly (which is an eventual `vim.snippet` design and is already a reality for several popular plugins) will have no good way of preventing `<Tab>` / `<S-Tab>` being forced after snippet expansion.

To extend on this, we'd also need a configuration option in core once we add support for LSP SnippetTextEdit - which can be triggered via code actions, code lens or inlay hints, etc. 

To me this seems like one of the worst compromises to tie this to lsp.completion.

Alternative proposal: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31887

> > will have no good way of preventing  /  being forced after snippet expansion.
> 
> Wat. The whole point of this is to _set_ these mappings ONLY in a specific context (and opt-in). Plugins can do whatever they want, and instruct users _not_ to opt-in if they handle this themselves.

I did miss the `if not self.navigation_mappings then return end` part in `vim.snippet`, which indeed makes for a better scoped usage of "forced" mappings.

Yet it still looks like having `vim.lsp.completion.enable()` will affect possibly completely unrelated usage of `vim.snippet.expand()` (with potentially different use cases). Due to [this monkey patching](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/aa9c38e04227fa52bda1efed532b0e5e3b91fe73/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/completion.lua#L663).

> We heard your mini.snippet desires, but frankly that's not enough to base a core design on.

@clason, please get your facts straight before making this kind of personal comments, okay? #30198 doesn't mention anything about 'mini.snippets' but only common `<Tab>` and `<S-Tab>` Insert mode mappings. 'mini.snippets' is already a thing with its way of allowing users to customize their mapping as they want to, which should be the case from the start.

> > A note: allowing configurable mappings on `vim.lsp.completion` level and not on `vim.snippet` level places plugins/users who directly use `vim.snippet` at a disadvantage. That means that any plugin wanting to use `vim.snippet` directly (which is an eventual `vim.snippet` design and is already a reality for several popular plugins) will have no good way of preventing `<Tab>` / `<S-Tab>` being forced after snippet expansion.
> 
> To extend on this, we'd also need a configuration option in core once we add support for LSP SnippetTextEdit - which can be triggered via code actions, code lens or inlay hints, etc.
> 
> To me this seems like one of the worst compromises to tie this to lsp.completion.
> 
> Alternative proposal: #31887

FWIW I do like your proposal better :)
